alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:42AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dallas County through 830 AM CDT... At 742 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cedar Hill, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dallas, Garland, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Rowlett, Desoto, Cedar Hill, Duncanville, Lancaster, Balch Springs, University Park, Seagoville, Glenn Heights, Red Oak, Highland Park, Hutchins, Cockrell Hill, Sunnyvale, Wilmer and Ovilla. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35E between mile markers 411 and 432. Interstate 20 between mile markers 454 and 485. Interstate 30 between mile markers 38 and 64. Interstate 45 between mile markers 267 and 284. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
